newsitem.title: USA: US LPGs steady to higher amid trader buying.
newsitem.headline: US LPGs steady to higher amid trader buying.

text.p: U.S. spot liquefied petroleum gas prices were steady to higher in moderate activity on Tuesday amid trader interest in normal butane, players said.
In Conway, Kansas, normal butane popped up 1.25 cents to deals done at 39.25 cents a gallon. 39.50 cents was also done, but seen as a panic buy amid tight supplies.
"There were mostly traders out buying but I think they are fronting for refiners," said one Conway player.
There was talk of refiner interest in the U.S. Gulf Coast, where normal butane was up about a quarter cent at 41.00/41.25 cents.
U.S. Gulf propane, however, was largely steady at 35.00/35.25 cents but Conway material was up a half cent at 37.00/37.25 cents.
Meanwhile, an international broker said Korea's strategic reserve is looking to buy within the next few days 125,000 tonnes of propane. The concern is likely to buy from Middle East suppliers.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
